thread.title: Brokerage ends Q4 with great homes sales
thread.title_full: Brokerage ends Q4 with great homes sales

author: @dallasnews
title: Brokerage ends Q4 with great homes sales
text:
Despite a slowdown in other parts of the country, the real estate market in the Dallas region remained strong through the end of 2023 and into the new year, with Allie Beth Allman & Associates agents posting several significant sales. It’s all part of what the brokerage’s experts observe is a new seasonality: a slower month or two in late fall, followed by a busy December as serious buyers try to lock down their new residences for the new year. The experts say the holiday has become a strong season for homebuying.
Advertisement Here’s a look at some of the extraordinary homes the experts at Allie Beth Allman & Associates helped their clients sell across the Dallas-Fort Worth area in recent weeks. Note that in many cases, the boutique luxury brokerage also brought the buyer, a testament to the agents’ strong networks that help get homes sold quickly and smoothly.
Advertisement Just before Thanksgiving, Brittany Mathews showed the neoclassical residence at 3607 Euclid Ave. to Alex Perry and his buyer client, who loved it. Located in Highland Park, the four-bedroom home has a stately design with two-story columns highlighting the brick exterior.
